data.title: Hospital stops taking 30-baht patient referrals
data.description: Mongkutwattana Hospital has stopped treating outpatient referrals under the universal coverage healthcare card, or gold card scheme, to help contain financial losses.

data.title: New threats in regional drugs fight
data.description: Cross-border and multisectoral cooperation among countries in the greater Mekong subregion (GMS) is needed to mitigate illicit drugs, says the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

data.title: Cancer Anywhere scheme 'hurting hospitals'
data.description: Experts are urging the National Health Security Office (NHSO) to scrap the  Cancer Anywhere  (CA) programme after several major public hospitals reported operating losses due to the overwhelming number of patients requesting cancer treatment.

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: SEPANG: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: Second edition of ‘workation’ project launched
data.description: The second edition of a project featuring pop-up working spaces in five destinations across Thailand was launched on Sunday in a bid to campaign “workations” in the country.

data.title: Thai PM Paetongtarn on list of 100 most powerful women in world
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  is listed among the "100 World’s  Most Powerful Women  2024" by  Forbes Magazine .

data.title: Loan shark targets ministry canteen in Bangkok
data.description: Two people have been arrested in the food court at the Ministry of Culture’s office in Bangkok

data.title: Floods in 4 southern Thai provinces affect bus, train services
data.description: Flooding remained in the southern Thai provinces of Chumphon, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Ranong and Surat Thani on Sunday, hampering bus and train services.

data.title: Two missing in landslide on Thailand's Koh Samui
data.description: SURAT THANI: Rescue workers and soldiers are battling to find two Myanmar  construction workers  still  missing  after a  landslide  buried their shelter on the tourist island of Koh  Samui  early Sunday.

data.title: Five Chinese men allegedly found working as labourers in Bangkok
data.description: Police raid follows tips that foreigners might be working illegally at demolition site

data.title: Commerce minister vows to remove Thailand from US IP Watch List
data.description: Negotiations set with United States Trade Representative

data.title: Loan shark targets ministry canteen
data.description: Two people have been arrested in the food court of the Ministry of Culture’s office in Huai Khwang district for loansharking, according to the Crime Suppression Division on Sunday.

data.title: PM on list of 100 most powerful women in world
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  is listed among the "100 World’s  Most Powerful Women  2024" by  Forbes Magazine .

data.title: Warning issued about use of e-cigarettes by children and adolescents
data.description: Rising use attributed to lack of awareness regarding hidden dangers of these products

data.title: Govt says key confidence indices rose because of 10,000-baht handouts
data.description: Three confidence indices rose because of first phase of handout programme, Paopoom says

data.title: Turkey ready to offer military training to Syria if new govt requests
data.description: ANKARA - The new administration in  Syria  should be given a chance to govern following their constructive messages, and  Turkey  stands ready to provide military training if such help is requested, Turkish Defence Minister Yasar Guler said.

data.title: Woman arrested after Thai-British beauty queen loses B4m in 'fake cop' scam
data.description: A woman, 40, was arrested in Chaiyaphum province for allegedly opening a  mule bank account  for a Cambodia-based  scam gang  that tricked Thai-British beauty queen  Charlotte Austin  out of 4 million baht.

data.title: Army engineering corps to help flood victims in Surat Thani, Chumphon
data.description: Two engineering-corps units to move from southern border provinces

data.title: Woman arrested after Thai-British beauty queen loses B4m in 'fake cop' scam
data.description: A woman, 40, was arrested in Chaiyaphum province for allegedly opening a  mule bank account  for a Cambodia-based  scam gang  that tricked Thai-British beauty queen  Charlotte Austin  out of 4 million baht.

data.title: Paetongtarn leaves for official visit to Malaysia
data.description: Delegation to attend annual bilateral consultation in Putrajaya as invited by Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim

data.title: Sirikanya warns govt of economic woes next year
data.description: Thailand likely to be hit by intensified trade wars, People’s Party MP says

data.title: Total cost of online scams revealed
data.description: Online scams cost victims 77.36 billion baht in damages from March 1, 2022, to November 30 this year, government spokesman Karom Polpornklang reported on Sunday.

data.title: 80 marching bands face-off in Thailand World Music Championships
data.description: Thailand World Music Championships (TWMC), a contest among over 80 marching bands from seven countries, is scheduled to take place in Si Sa Ket province from December 18-21.

data.title: Thai golfers Patty Tavatanakit, Jeeno Thitikul shine at Grant Thornton Invitational
data.description: Patty Tavatanakit of Thailand and Jake Knapp recorded seven birdies to extend their lead during windy and wet conditions at the Grant Thornton Invitational on Saturday at Tiburon Golf Club in Naples, Florida, US.

data.title: Australia says 'Bali Nine' prisoners have returned home
data.description: The five remaining members of the Australian "Bali Nine" drug ring have returned home after 19 years in jail in Indonesia, the Australian government said Sunday.

data.title: Four major tourism segments in focus as TAT focuses on niche markets
data.description: Agency banks on spending power of wealthy millennials from Asia

data.title: Illegal Chinese construction workers arrested in Bangkok's ‘Little China’
data.description: Five Chinese men aged 34-61 were arrested in Bangkok
